body:
- A new object is created regardless, no? (`graph.ref()` is creating a new object), so the same for both cases?
- The exception: That seems fine. IIUC, the only contract is that if `a.equals(b)` then `a.hashCode() == b.hashCode()`, right? So, throwing an exception in `hashCode()` doesn't really help anyway?
body_html:
• A new object is created regardless, no? (graph.ref() is creating a new object), so the same for both cases?
  • The exception: That seems fine. IIUC, the only contract is that if a.equals(b) then a.hashCode() == b.hashCode(), right? So, throwing an exception in hashCode() doesn't really help anyway?
body_text:
A new object is created regardless, no? (graph.ref() is creating a new object), so the same for both cases?
The exception: That seems fine. IIUC, the only contract is that if a.equals(b) then a.hashCode() == b.hashCode(), right? So, throwing an exception in hashCode() doesn't really help anyway?
